title: Introduction to Vegetable Science
description: Environmental and cultural principles involved in the production of California vegetable crops; temperature, daylength and fertility effects on production and yield, use of plastic mulches and row covers, and use of transplants. Harvest principles and precooling methods. Not open to Agricultural and Environmental Plant Science majors, Crop Science majors, nor students with credit in VGSCÂ 190. 3 lectures, 1 laboratory.
